etymologies: late 17th century: from Latin octans, octant- ‘half-quadrant’, from octo ‘eight’

definitions: an arc of a circle equal to one eighth of its circumference, or the area enclosed by such an arc with two radii of the circle.
shortDefinitions: arc of circle equal to one eighth of its circumference, or area enclosed by such arc with two radii of circle

definitions: each of eight parts into which a space or solid body is divided by three planes which intersect (especially at right angles) at a single point.
shortDefinitions: each of eight parts into which space is divided by three planes which intersect

definitions: an obsolete instrument in the form of a graduated eighth of a circle, used in astronomy and navigation.
shortDefinitions: obsolete instrument in form of graduated eighth of circle
